result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glen Dale Lamorie

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:06 AM Defendant Glen Dale Lamorie in court.  Attorney Kevin Van Ert appeared by video for Glen Dale Lamorie.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Through Counsel DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing, and indicates DEF will be seeking treatment.    DEF may appear by zoom, if in treatment.   Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:15 AM Defendant Glen Dale Lamorie appeared by video, in custody.   Attorney Gabriel Pollak (Special Appearance) appears by video.   Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court reviews court record.  Warrant quashed.   Attny Pollak makes statement  as to missed appearance.   Court addresses DEF, DEF responds.   SIBS $2500.  Attny Pollak indicates DEF does qualify for PD appointment.  
Initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
SERVED -  LCO PD  Ian Junker  9/11/2022  @ 10:25 AM
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Uploaded warrant document to ShareFile and sent paper copy to Sheriff's Department.  No warrant card generated.

09:34 AM  Defendant Glen Dale Lamorie not in court.  Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. State requests warrant.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized (Statewide) as requested.
